pageContext.claim: “The individual mandate is gone, the most unpopular part of Obamacare, and we almost have Obamacare gone. We're close.”
pageContext.analysis: This is mostly false. The Trump administration reduced the individual mandate to zero, so that people no longer pay a penalty, but it technically remains on the books as law. The vast majority of the Affordable Care Act -- the coverage guarantee for people with pre-existing conditions, the health insurance marketplace and subsidies, and an expansion of Medicaid -- remain in place.
